setTokenizer

public void setTokenizer(PluginTokenizer)
Description copied from interface: Plugin
When registering an instance that implements this interface, the PluginTokenizer will call this method to make itself known to the SeparatorHandler instance in turn.

Specified by:
setTokenizer in interface Plugin
Parameters:
- the controlling PluginTokenizer

readWhitespaces

public int readWhitespaces(int,
                           int)
Description copied from interface: WhitespaceHandler
This method detects the number of whitespace characters starting at the given position. It should use Tokenizer.getChar(int) to retrieve a character to check.
The method should return the number of characters identified as whitespaces starting from and including the given start position.
Do not attempt to actually read more data or do anything that leads to the change of the data source or to tokenizer switching. This is done by the tokenizer framework.

Specified by:
readWhitespaces in interface WhitespaceHandler
Parameters:
- start checking for whitespace from this position
- if there is no non-whitespace character, read up to this number of characters
Returns:
number of whitespace characters starting from the given offset

isWhitespace

public boolean isWhitespace(char)
Description copied from interface: WhitespaceHandler
This method checks if the character is a whitespace.

Specified by:
isWhitespace in interface WhitespaceHandler
Parameters:
- check this character
Returns:
true if the given character is a whitespace, false otherwise

isSequenceCommentOrString

public TokenizerProperty isSequenceCommentOrString(int,
                                                   int)
Description copied from interface: SequenceHandler
Return a TokenizerProperty if the character starting at the given position comprise a special sequence (like the ++ operator in C and Java or the &bsp; in HTML), a comment starting sequence or a string sign.
Return null if no special sequence is present at the given position.
Use the AbstractTokenizer.getCharUnchecked(int) to retrieve a character from the tokenizers input buffer.

Specified by:
isSequenceCommentOrString in interface SequenceHandler
Parameters:
- check from this position in the tokenizers input buffer
- analyze at most that number of characters
Returns:
a TokenizerProperty instance describing the special sequence, comment etc. or null if no such thing was found.

getSequenceMaxLength

public int getSequenceMaxLength()
Description copied from interface: SequenceHandler
This method is called by the parent PluginTokenizer to learn how many characters are needed by an instance of this interface to identify a special sequence in the worst case. Usually that should be the length of the longest possible special sequence, comment prefix etc. The tokenizer will make sure that at least this number of characters is available when SequenceHandler.isSequenceCommentOrString(int, int) is called. If less characters are provided, EOF is reached.

Specified by:
getSequenceMaxLength in interface SequenceHandler
Returns:
the number of characters needed in the worst case to identify a special sequence
